dcterms:creator: A. Sandryhaila
J. M. Moura
dcterms:description: The graph Fourier transform allows for the processing of graph signals in the graph frequency domain, which is essential for applications such as signal denoising and smoothing.
dcterms:title: Graph Fourier Transform

dcterms:creator: X. Shi
H. Feng
M. Zhai
T. Yang
B. Hu
dcterms:description: The rational Butterworth filter is utilized in the design of ARMA graph filters, particularly in wireless sensor networks.
dcterms:title: Rational Butterworth Filter

dcterms:creator: O. Rimleanscaia
E. Isuﬁ
dcterms:description: The rational Chebyshev filter is employed in the design of ARMA graph filters, providing a method for achieving desired frequency responses.
dcterms:title: Rational Chebyshev Filter

dcterms:creator: T. Aittomaki
G. Leus
dcterms:description: The WLS design method is a technique for designing graph filters using a sum-of-squares representation, which addresses stability in filter design.
dcterms:title: WLS Design Method

dcterms:creator: J. Liu
E. Isuﬁ
G. Leus
dcterms:description: The iterative scheme is used for filter design in autoregressive moving average graph filters, focusing on stability and convergence.
dcterms:title: Iterative Scheme

dcterms:creator: C.-C. Tseng
S.-L. Lee
dcterms:description: The FIR filter design method utilizes a least-squares approach with a parameter norm penalty, contributing to the design of graph filters.
dcterms:title: FIR Filter Design
